channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for OR
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for OR

item.title: Report X-2023101326
item.description:
Report X-2023101326

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-21T18:13:39+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-17
  • City: EUGENE
  • State: OR
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was unloaded from the trailer leaking liquid. package was immediately placed into hazmat leak bag and taken to QA for evaluation/Processing. DescribePack: Package contained 4 1 gallon jugs of Nox Smoke II. One jug had the cap broken off causing contents to leak when package was unloaded and tilted on side. DurationRel: 2 and MitigateEffect: Package was placed into hazmat leak bag/tote to contain the leak and prevent further leaking. package was taken to QA for evaluation.

item.title: Report X-2023101153
item.description:
Report X-2023101153

  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: THE DESIGNATED RESPONDER ARRIVED TO DOOR 32 WITH PPE ON AND FOLLOWED THE DECISION TREE AND THE APPROPRIATE RESPONSE SHEET. DESIGNATED RESPONDER BROUGHT THE LEAKING HAZMAT PACKAGE BACK TO PSC. THE 5 GALLON PLASTIC PAIL HAZMAT PACKAGE WAS PROCESS AS DMP.

item.title: Report X-2023101303
item.description:
Report X-2023101303

  • Hazmat Injuries: 0

  • Description: SequenceEvent: PACKAGE CAME TO QA LEAKING. UPON CLOSER INSPECTION FOUND THAT THE PLASTIC BOTTLES HAD LOOSE CAPS CAUSING THE CONTENTS TO LEAK OUT INTO THE BOX. ALL LIQUID ABSORBED BY THE BOX. DescribePack: LOOSE CAPS NO SAFTEY SEAL DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: PUT IN TOTE AND BROUGHT TO QA

item.title: Report X-2023101021
item.description:
Report X-2023101021

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-16T18:13:10+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-11
  • City: TROUTDALE
  • State: OR
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: PACKAGE HAD A LOOSE CAP DURING SORTATION ALLOWING THE CONTENTS TO LEAK. DescribePack: CLOSURE THE SIZE OF A STANDARD 5 GALLON BUCKET LET WAS LOOSE ENOUGH THAT ABOUT 8 OUNCES OF LIQUID LEAKED FROM THE CONTAINER. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: PLASTIC PAIL WAS PLACED IN PLASTIC BAG LINED TOTE AND BROUGHT TO QA FOR IMMEDIATE INSPECTION.

item.title: Report X-2023100711
item.description:
Report X-2023100711

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-15T15:11:35+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-22
  • City: PDX
  • State: OR
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: ALASKA AIRLINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: X-2023100711-Consumer markings on outside of 5 gallon (non hazmat) item which was part of shipment indicated possibly X-flammable and triggered agent to inspect entirety of shipment including inside large wheeled tote which contained all undeclared dangerous goods X-2023100712-Undeclared dangerous goods discovered in wheeled tote after agent noticed consumer hazard markings on outside of separate item in shipment X-2023100713-undeclared dangerous goods discovered in large wheeled tote after agent noticed consumer flammability warning label on outside of another item in shipment 6 aerosol cans x 13 ounces
